metadata.name: Malicious PE Execution by Microsoft Visual Studio Debugger
metadata.comment: There is an option for a MS VS Just-In-Time Debugger "vsjitdebugger.exe" to launch specified executable and attach a debugger. This option may be used adversaries to execute malicious code by signed verified binary. The debugger is installed alongside with Microsoft Visual Studio package.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\vsjitdebugger.exe')) AND NOT (lower(process.name) regexp '.*\\vsimmersiveactivatehelper.*\.exe' OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\devenv.exe'))))

output.summary: There is an option for a MS VS Just-In-Time Debugger "vsjitdebugger.exe" to launch specified executable and attach a debugger. This option may be used adversaries to execute malicious code by signed verified binary. The debugger is installed alongside with Microsoft Visual Studio package.

metadata.objective: False positive: The process spawned by vsjitdebugger.exe is uncommon.
